item.title: Drain filled with leaves, 31st October
item.description:
The drain in East Way at the junction with Bourne Vale is becoming filled with leaves and will rapidly become blocked. Please would you act to remove the leaves so the drain is clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed base left on street, 31st October
item.description:

item.title: Fly-tipped waste - cul-de-sac of Ravenscourt Road, 31st October
item.description:
There is fly-tipped waste in the cul-de-sac of Ravenscourt Road. This includes a table, boxes and scattered litter. Please could this be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 262-276, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Clothes and other paraphernalia thrown into bushes, 31st October
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Northchurch Terrace, Hackney, London

item.title: Offensive graffiti - alleyway between Ravenscourt Road and Silverdale Road, 31st October
item.description:
There is racially offensive graffiti on the brown concrete fencepost at the entrance to the alleyway, near lamppost 42F6. Seen circa 2025-10-30 15:00 Please could this be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 262-276, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 31st October
item.description:
Since yesterday, a large amount of rubbish has been left outside the building, and for some reason, the collection trucks keep passing without picking it up. Could you please look into this? The street looks quite messy and unhygienic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Richmond Buildings, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large blue lorry branded idling for at least half an hour before going into the Crown estate building at 7.50., 31st October
item.description:
Idling lorry causing pollution and disturbance. Regular problem with lorries going into or out of John Lewis as others have reported. Three times in past week big refrigerated lorries sat on the street close to homes for up to an hour with generators going and are extremely loud
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Bessborough Place, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet
